summary: This document is an email chain from November 29, 2021, discussing updates to public information regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It involves court staff coordinating to correct outdated information on a Department of Justice webpage about trial access, specifically noting there will be no public audio feed and clarifying in-person attendance procedures.

persons.name: Joseph Pecorino
persons.context: Sends initial link to the Maxwell case page and is involved in the email chain about updating public access information.

persons.name: Edward Friedland
persons.context: Identifies outdated information on the public webpage regarding trial access and requests an update to reflect the correct in-person attendance order.

persons.name: Matthew Rogers
persons.context: Copied on an email forwarding information about updating the Maxwell trial webpage.

persons.name: McEnany
persons.context: Mentioned as having asked 'Wendy' to work on the webpage update task.

persons.name: Wendy
persons.context: Mentioned as someone McEnany asked to work on the webpage update; another staffer is suggested to touch base with her.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the trial for which public access information is being discussed and updated.

connections.description: Colleagues within the United States District Court Southern District of New York, communicating about court administrative matters.
Colleagues copied on the same email regarding court administrative updates.
McEnany asked Wendy to work on the task of updating the trial information webpage.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Proceedings
events.description: The trial is ongoing, with the jury being sworn in and a 45-minute lunch break scheduled. Court staff are coordinating to update public information about access.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Ghislaine Maxwell trial was actively proceeding on November 29, 2021, with jury swearing and breaks.
Court officials identified and corrected outdated public information stating phone access was available, clarifying attendance was in-person only per a court order.
A specific directive was issued that 'There will not be a public audio feed in this trial.'
The email chain shows internal court administrative coordination to manage public access information during a high-profile trial.
